meanings.definition: Plants with sticky leaves or stems that adhere to clothing or skin.
meanings.sent1: The stickweeds in the garden made my hands messy.
meanings.sent2: I had to carefully remove the stickweeds from my clothes after hiking.
meanings.sent3: The stickweeds seemed to enjoy clinging to my shoes like tiny hitchhikers.
meanings.sent4: The stickweeds held onto my jacket as if they were determined to stay.
meanings.sent5: The stickweeds felt like tiny magnets, attracting everything they touched.

meanings.definition: A type of weed that grows in clusters and can be difficult to remove.
meanings.sent1: The stickweeds in the yard kept coming back no matter how many times I pulled them out.
meanings.sent2: The stickweeds spread quickly and soon covered the entire flower bed.
meanings.sent3: Trying to get rid of the stickweeds felt like a never-ending battle.
meanings.sent4: The stickweeds intertwined with each other, forming a dense mat of green.
meanings.sent5: The stickweeds seemed to mock my attempts to eradicate them, growing back stronger each time.

meanings.definition: To become entangled or stuck in stickweeds.
meanings.sent1: I accidentally stickweeds my hand in the thorny bush while trying to retrieve a ball.
meanings.sent2: She stickweeds her foot in the overgrown grass and stumbled.
meanings.sent3: As I tried to walk through the field, I managed to stickweeds myself in the stickweeds.
meanings.sent4: The more I struggled, the deeper I seemed to stickweeds in the stickweeds.
meanings.sent5: I felt like I was stickweeds in a web of stickweeds, unable to break free.
